title: [Large-scale] Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM) Communication Simulation Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational nursing knowledge, patient counseling experience, and understanding of basic vocabulary and grammatical structures required in medical settings
context.additional_context: A training course where pre-service teachers use smartphone apps to practice CAM (Complementary and Alternative Medicine)-related communication skills via virtual patient scenarios. Emphasizes improving linguistic accuracy and context-appropriate expression through text-based dialogue analysis and speech evaluation.

learning_goals: Learners listen to a virtual patientâ€™s concerns about CAM (Complementary and Alternative Medicine) use in a simulation environment and provide appropriate feedback with empathetic expressions and clear vocabulary choices.
Learners develop strategies for educating patients on CAM use based on risk-benefit assessments and cultivate the ability to translate complex medical information into everyday language.
Learners improve communication self-efficacy by 20% or more through simulation result analysis and identify effective expression strategies in patient-doctor dialogue transcripts.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
